title: Carotid Artery Plaque Analysis in 3D Based on Distance Encoding in Mesh Representations
author: Hinrich Rahlfs (Institute of Computer-Assisted Cardiovascular Medicine, Deutsches Herzzentrum der Charité), Markus Hullbrand (Fraunhofer MEVIS), Sebastian Schmitter (Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt), Christoph Strecker (Department of Neurology and Neurophysiology, University of Freiburg), Andreas Harloff (Department of Neurology and Neurophysiology, University of Freiburg), Anja Hennemuth (Fraunhofer MEVIS), ..., Hinrich Rahlfs (Institute of Computer-Assisted Cardiovascular Medicine, Deutsches Herzzentrum der Charité)
relevance_why: The proposed method for plaque mesh extraction could provide insights into geometric analysis, which might be applicable in audio signal analysis or restoration tasks, particularly those focusing on spatial signal representation.
background: The study analyzes carotid artery plaque in 3D using advanced imaging techniques to extract and visualize quantitative plaque parameters, which can aid in stroke risk assessment.
contribution: This paper introduces a mesh-based method for extracting and visualizing carotid artery plaques in 3D to evaluate stroke risk factors using quantitative plaque parameters.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods mainly focused on 2D cross-sectional analysis or manual segmentation, limiting comprehensiveness and introducing variability.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves the analysis by employing a distance-encoded mesh representation, enabling extraction and quantification of plaque properties in three dimensions.

key_innovation: Utilizes a case-specific threshold to enhance the precision of plaque extraction, thus minimizing false positives in healthy subjects.
real_world_impact: The method could significantly improve non-invasive assessments of carotid artery health, contributing to better stroke risk management and patient outcomes.
limitations: The method relies heavily on segmentation quality, potentially impacting extraction effectiveness in challenging cases.

new_terms.distance encoding: **Distance encoding** refers to a method of representing distances in a way that facilitates the identification and analysis of structures, in this case used for the carotid artery plaques.
new_terms.mesh representation: **Mesh representation** involves creating a 3D model that outlines the geometry of an object using vertices, edges, and faces, enabling detailed analysis.
